languages.text: "Сципионцы держатся замкнуто, но бригадиры не замечены в проявлениях нелояльности. Они первыми вызвались вернуться на развалины Сципионы 84-249 и наладили расчистку завалов. Они... безусловно полезны и привычны славить Императора трудом. А горе утраты дома и стойкость, с которой они его приняли, сделало их героями и мучениками в глазах других простолюдинов".

"The Scipions keep to themselves, but the foremen have not shown any signs of disloyalty. They were the first to volunteer to return to the ruins of Scipione 84-249 and set up the debris removal project. They are... certainly useful and are accustomed to praising the Emperor through their labour. Moreover, their grief at the loss of their home and the resilience with which they have accepted it made them to appear like heroes and martyrs in the eyes of other commoners."
languages.original_text: "Сципионцы держатся замкнуто, но бригадиры не замечены в проявлениях нелояльности. Они первыми вызвались вернуться на развалины Сципионы 84-249 и наладили расчистку завалов. Они... безусловно полезны и привычны славить Императора трудом. А горе утраты дома и стойкость, с которой они его приняли, сделало их героями и мучениками в глазах других простолюдинов".

And their grief at the loss of their home and the resilience with which they have accepted it made them to look like heroes and martyrs in the eyes of other commoners."

languages.text: “希皮奥内人恪守本分，那些警督也没有表现出任何不忠的迹象。他们是第一批自愿返回希皮奥内84-249废墟，开始清理的人。他们……确实很有用，习惯于通过辛勤劳动来赞美帝皇。尽管他们因失去家园而悲痛不已，但他们却以坚韧不拔的态度接受了这样的事实。在其他平民眼里，他们就像是英雄或烈士一样。”
languages.original_text: "The Scipions keep to themselves, but the brigadiers have not shown any signs of disloyalty. They were the first to volunteer to return to the ruins of Scipions 84-249 and set up the debris removal project.. They are... certainly useful and are accustomed to praising the Emperor through their labour. Moreover, their grief at the loss of their home and the resilience with which they have accepted it made them to appear like heroes and martyrs in the eyes of other commoners."

traits.locale_text: “希皮奥内人恪守本分，那些警督也没有表现出任何不忠的迹象。他们是第一批自愿返回希皮奥内84-249废墟，开始清理的人。他们……确实很有用，习惯于通过辛勤劳动来赞美帝皇。尽管他们因失去家园而悲痛不已，但他们却以坚韧不拔的态度接受了这样的事实。在其他平民眼里，他们就像是英雄或烈士一样。”

languages.text: «Los Escipiones son reservados, pero los brigadistas no han dado muestras de deslealtad. Fueron los primeros en ofrecerse voluntarios para volver a las ruinas de Escipión 84-249 y poner en marcha el proyecto de desescombro... Son... realmente útiles y suelen alabar al Emperador con su trabajo. Además, su dolor por la pérdida de su hogar y la entereza con que la han aceptado les han hecho aparecer como héroes y mártires a los ojos de los demás plebeyos».
languages.original_text: "The Scipions keep to themselves, but the brigadiers have not shown any signs of disloyalty. They were the first to volunteer to return to the ruins of Scipions 84-249 and set up the debris removal project.. They are... certainly useful and are accustomed to praising the Emperor through their labour. Moreover, their grief at the loss of their home and the resilience with which they have accepted it made them to appear like heroes and martyrs in the eyes of other commoners."

traits.locale_text: «Los Escipiones son reservados, pero los brigadistas no han dado muestras de deslealtad. Fueron los primeros en ofrecerse voluntarios para volver a las ruinas de Escipión 84-249 y poner en marcha el proyecto de desescombro... Son... realmente útiles y suelen alabar al Emperador con su trabajo. Además, su dolor por la pérdida de su hogar y la entereza con que la han aceptado les han hecho aparecer como héroes y mártires a los ojos de los demás plebeyos».

languages.text: 「サイピオーネの住人は閉じこもっているが、准将たちは不忠実なそぶりを見せていない。彼らは、いち早く志願してサイピオーネ84-249の廃墟に戻り、瓦礫撤去のプロジェクトを立ち上げた...彼らは...とても有用であり、その労働を通じて皇帝を称賛してきた。そのうえ、故郷を失った悲しみと、それを受け入れ困難から立ち直る姿勢を見せたことで、他の民の目には英雄や殉教者のように映ったのだ」
languages.original_text: "The Scipions keep to themselves, but the brigadiers have not shown any signs of disloyalty. They were the first to volunteer to return to the ruins of Scipions 84-249 and set up the debris removal project.. They are... certainly useful and are accustomed to praising the Emperor through their labour. Moreover, their grief at the loss of their home and the resilience with which they have accepted it made them to appear like heroes and martyrs in the eyes of other commoners."

traits.locale_text: 「サイピオーネの住人は閉じこもっているが、准将たちは不忠実なそぶりを見せていない。彼らは、いち早く志願してサイピオーネ84-249の廃墟に戻り、瓦礫撤去のプロジェクトを立ち上げた...彼らは...とても有用であり、その労働を通じて皇帝を称賛してきた。そのうえ、故郷を失った悲しみと、それを受け入れ困難から立ち直る姿勢を見せたことで、他の民の目には英雄や殉教者のように映ったのだ」

languages.text: « Les Scipioniens sont du genre réservé, mais les Brigadiers n'ont montré aucun signe d'infidélité. Ils étaient les premiers volontaires à retourner dans les ruines de Scipione 84-249 et à mettre en place le retrait des gravats. Ils sont clairement utiles et habitués à vénérer l'Empereur par leur travail, d'autant que la perte de leurs foyers et la façon dont ils l'ont accepté en ont fait des héros martyrs aux yeux de la population. »
languages.original_text: "The Scipions keep to themselves, but the brigadiers have not shown any signs of disloyalty. They were the first to volunteer to return to the ruins of Scipions 84-249 and set up the debris removal project.. They are... certainly useful and are accustomed to praising the Emperor through their labour. Moreover, their grief at the loss of their home and the resilience with which they have accepted it made them to appear like heroes and martyrs in the eyes of other commoners."

traits.locale_text: « Les Scipioniens sont du genre réservé, mais les Brigadiers n'ont montré aucun signe d'infidélité. Ils étaient les premiers volontaires à retourner dans les ruines de Scipione 84-249 et à mettre en place le retrait des gravats. Ils sont clairement utiles et habitués à vénérer l'Empereur par leur travail, d'autant que la perte de leurs foyers et la façon dont ils l'ont accepté en ont fait des héros martyrs aux yeux de la population. »

languages.text: "Die Scipionen bleiben für sich, aber die Brigadiere haben keinerlei Zeichen von Abtrünnigkeit gezeigt. Sie haben sich als Erste freiwillig gemeldet, in die Ruinen von Scipione 84-249 zurückzukehren und mit der Beseitigung der Trümmer zu beginnen ... Sie sind ... sicherlich nützlich, und sind es gewohnt, dem Imperator durch ihre Arbeit zu huldigen. Zudem sind sie in den Augen des übrigens Pöbels Helden und Märtyrer — wegen ihrer Trauer ob des Verlusts ihrer Heimat sowie der Widerstandsfähigkeit, mit der sie diesen Verlust akzeptiert haben."
languages.original_text: "The Scipions keep to themselves, but the brigadiers have not shown any signs of disloyalty. They were the first to volunteer to return to the ruins of Scipions 84-249 and set up the debris removal project.. They are... certainly useful and are accustomed to praising the Emperor through their labour. Moreover, their grief at the loss of their home and the resilience with which they have accepted it made them to appear like heroes and martyrs in the eyes of other commoners."
